trans-unit.source: Provides a way to determine whether a value is greater than or less than a specified value, or whether a value is between two specified values.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.QueryExtender> control provides the ability to filter data in a Web page by using classes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions> namespace.
These classes include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression> class searches a data column using a pair of values that define the range.
You use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.DataField%2A> property to specify the column to search.

You use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MinType%2A> property to specify whether to include or exclude the minimum in the search results, and you use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MaxType%2A> property to specify whether to include or exclude the maximum value.

The maximum and minimum values can be specified in [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] controls and the values can then be passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.QueryExtender> control as parameters in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ControlParameter> controls.
The results are typically displayed in a data-bound control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the field to use for the comparison.
The range expression searches data field for the specified range.
The field to use for the comparison.
Gets the <xref href="System.Linq.IQueryable"></xref> object that the range comparison was performed on.
This method uses the specified <xref:System.Linq.IQueryable> object to resolve the expression.
The object to use for the comparison.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Linq.IQueryable"></xref> object that the expression was applied to.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.DataField"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MinType"></xref> and the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MaxType"></xref> properties are set to <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.None"></xref>.
-or-

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MinType"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MaxType"></xref> property is not set to <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.None"></xref> and the parameter collection is empty.
Gets or sets the maximum value of the range.

Possible values for this property are <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.Inclusive>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.Exclusive>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.None>.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MaxType%2A> is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.Inclusive>, the maximum value of the range is included in the search results.
This is equivalent to performing a >= operation.
If you set the property to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.Exclusive> field, it is equivalent to specifying a > or < operation.
If you set the property to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.None>, no limit is imposed on the range.
The type of comparison to use for the maximum value.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.None"></xref>, which indicates that the maximum comparison is not performed.
Gets or sets the minimum value of the range.

Possible values for this property are <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.Inclusive>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.Exclusive>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.None>.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MinType%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MaxType%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.Inclusive>, the minimum and maximum value of the range is included in the search results.
This is equivalent to performing a >= or \<= operation.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.Exclusive> field is equivalent to the > or < operation and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.None> imposes no limit on the range.
The type of comparison to use for the minimum value.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType.None"></xref>, which indicates that the minimum comparison is not performed.
